title: 113_hr4173
content: The Act titled "Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014" establishes a program for innovative financing in brownfield redevelopment and economic development. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program, established by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, guarantees loans for brownfield redevelopment and urban renewal projects. Eligibility requires a master plan meeting specific requirements and certification from the Environmental Protection Agency. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program requires a master plan meeting specific requirements, certification from the Environmental Protection Agency for brownfield redevelopment projects. Loan eligibility is based on specific project costs for brownfield site acquisition, remediation, facility relocation, and site preparation. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program sets criteria for loan guarantees, including restrictions on contamination responsibility, number of loans, and minimum loan amount of $25,000,000. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program sets criteria for loan guarantees, including a minimum loan amount of $25,000,000, with a maximum of $150,000,000 based on project cost. The loan bears negotiated interest, with a maturity term of 20-30 years and no repayment required for the first 10 years. The master plan for a brownfield redevelopment project funded by a loan guarantee must include a project description, activities schedule, budget, and demonstrate major redevelopment impact on economic development and environmental quality in the community. It should also show non-Federal funds commitment, the number of long-term jobs created, and repayment starting within 15 years after the loan is made. The master plan for a brownfield redevelopment project funded by a loan guarantee must include details on non-Federal funds committed, long-term job creation, environmental remediation, economic impact, affordable housing, reduced vehicle congestion and emissions, green technology integration, improved air quality, and complete streets planning. The selection criteria for receiving loan guarantees under the Program include evidence of non-Federal investment commitments, an approved remediation action plan, and favorable consideration for existing BRAC redevelopment projects with Federal assistance. The full faith and credit of the United States is pledged to the payment of guarantees made under this section, providing conclusive evidence of eligibility for obligations. The Federal Government is protected from liability for environmental remediation under loan guarantees. The Secretary will process all requests for loan guarantees under this section. The Secretary will process all requests for loan guarantees under this section using a similar approval process as section 108 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. Applicants must show a viable repayment schedule and provide sufficient collateral, which can include grants under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 allows applicants to provide collateral in forms other than grants, with Congressional oversight required before final approval of loan guarantees. Definitions include "BRAC redevelopment project" for sites designated by the Secretary of Defense and "brownfield." The curr_chunk discusses definitions related to brownfield redevelopment projects, including terms like brownfield, local redevelopment agency, remediation action plan, and Program. These definitions are crucial for understanding the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program established under this section. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will issue regulations for the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Program within 6 months. $100,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2015 for loan guarantees under this program, available through fiscal year 2019.
